intro: Aeschynanthus cryptanthus, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or winter jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking orange-red tubular flowers that bloom during the winter season. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit. Botanically, it belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is known for its unique floral structure and ornamental value.
